comments.body: This license doesn't seem to be the correct one for the font files.

What do you mean? The archive of the url contains a file named copying.txt file stating `This Font Software is licensed under the Ubuntu Font Licence, Version 1.0.  https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-font-licence` and the same archive contains a file LICENCE.txt with that license.

Ok, there is one thing. The zip archive behaves a bit different when extracted on linux/win vs. osx due to the included `__MACOSX/*` files. Those are ignored on extraction on osx, but not on linux/win, leading to one more subfolder level. The build.sh file handles that for all cases.
The license file in the PR had a conda-forge copy right

Ah, ok. The 4 font packages all reference the license file from their source archive in the recipe. The included LICENSE.txt files are for the two meta-packages and are just a copy of the staged-recipe/LICENSE.txt BSD license file with updated date. Is there any other preferred way to give licenses to meta-packages? May just `license: Various, license_family: Other` with no extra included `license_file`?
